intro: Cyrtandra glaucescens, commonly known as the blue cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine, waxy coating. Cyrtandra glaucescens prefers moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value has made it a sought-after species in horticulture, though it is not commonly cultivated outside its native range.
